Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: matkustajaM
Reviews.Content: It was very helpful and friendly staff at hotel. There was very warm and cozy spirit at hotel. They bring you tea or coffee to your room if you want. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Free internet in room and all hotel area. Tram stop over 150 meters from the hotel. Blue mosk, Topkapi, Hagiasofia, Spice Bazar, Grand Bazar and EminÃ¶nu ferry boat harbour are within walking distance. Good, typical turkish breakfast. Many good restaurant near hotel.

Reviews.Title: “...”
Reviews.Author: Roberts K
Reviews.Content: Responsive staff, good location, pretty cozy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,good service”
Reviews.Author: renas k
Reviews.Content: verygood hotel.five mÄ±nutes walk distance to main historical place of istanbul.such as hagiasofia,blue mosque and spice bazaar

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annika D
Reviews.Content: I liked my time in the Historical Preferred Hotel very much and will come back next time. Nice people, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Dear All at the Boutique Preferred Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: Macke M
Reviews.Content: We would all like to say a BIG thank you to all for such an enjoyable stay at your hotel. All of you made us so welcome and were kind and helpful. A special thank you to Mr. Yusuf and Mr.Medeni and Miss Shaliha and Mr. Yahya And all your staff, who not only gave us some fantastic information about Rome, places to go etc, but our own personal escort out of the city - that was fantastic. We will certainly be recommending your hotel to our friends and hope that we can return some time. Many thanks again â€¦â€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly rooms and ripped off!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ryk I
Reviews.Content: Despite seeing some very nice photos online, this was NOT our experience! The first room we were shown was tatty to say the least, and when I opened the wardrobe door - it fell off, the lamp was broken and the shower had black mould all over it! We were shown to another room which was marginally better, but the plaster was coming off the walls and the toilet was INSIDE the shower, literally! The cleaners were good and some of the staff were helpful however. The breakfast was monotonous and the breakfast room not fit for purpose. When it came to paying the bill, they insisted on coverting our agreed price to euros, resulting in us paying an extra Â£150 to the agreed price. The location extremely noisy during the night, we felt it was a fire risk, the fire exit on our floor was jammed shut with the fire extinguisher and heaven forbid we would have had to use that fire escape! Happily all of our other experiences in Istanbul made up for that awful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: slikchevy
Reviews.Content: There were both good and not great things about this hotel, but overall quite pleased with the experience. The staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating, always offering tea when returning to the hotel after being out and about. Offered good advice about touring the city, what activities to do, made phone calls on your behalf, offered to drive you somewhere if you needed, and Istanbul is BIG. Breakfast is different, so don't expect typical European buffet - some eggs and sausage, jam, basic cereal, but you're in Turkey so try olives, pickled vegetables, salty cheese, savory pastry and lots of yogurt. The hotel furnishings in the room are somewhat dated, and yes, the bathroom and balcony doors didn't shut properly and there could have been better lighting in the rooms, and if you don't shower before 8:30, the water may run out, but the view of the Bosphorous was spectacular, the balcony had a great street view and the sultan's lounge was an exotic touch and the tiles in the bathroom were colorful. It may not meet everyone's standards, but I liked it, and the location was absolutely fantastic. Eat lots of eggplant, many different ways, and visit the landmarks early to get the best photo shots with the least amount of people, because there are lots of queues. And drink freshly squeezed pomegranate at the fruit stalls, a great energy boost. And listen out for the muezzin during the day. I finally recommend introducing yourself to Istanbul initially with a hop on/off bus sightseeing tour starting at the Hippodrome to get your bearings of the city, a valuable introduction to the fantastic sights. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I will never spend any time at that hotel”
Reviews.Author: airjumper
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for three people from that hotel. Their websites were different than the rooms, there were no airport transfer for free although they promised that. Our room supposed to be a suite 40m2 but we have a room about 15m2, the bathroom was very very small and everything was just about broken. I try to get explanation from the hotel staff but always the manager was somewhere else and so i never get any explanation with anything. We supposed to have a great balcony with a good wiev over the bosporian, yes we have a balcony...we have steel stairs behind our window and the stairs were so bad i wonder if anybody can even climb tose stairs. So we have a terrible hotelroom and i do not recommend this hotel for no one. But our 5-days vacation was exelent, we love Istanbul it is very exotic and mystic city and the people here are so friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: PiaZ63
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel, not least because of the superb service from the staff, who were immensely helpful and friendly. Yusuf and Mehmet especially made us feel very comfortable and welcome at all times, and made sure we had everything we needed. Also, the location is perfect, most major sights are immediately available by foot. All in all, a great hotel that we would definitely recommend and will be returning to!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: Theapigen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was even better than expected! The location was great, and the staff were extremely friendly. Especially Mehmet was always very friendly and helpful, gave us great advice about the city, and catered to our every need with a very positive attitude. We would definitely come back to this hotel, particularly because of the wonderful staff. Thanks a lot :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel nearby everything :D”
Reviews.Author: BiBi_1110
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. Room were clean and comfortable and we had nice breakfast every morning before we went sightseeing. Many thanks to helpful and friendly staff, especially Mr Mehmet Ay who were most helpful and serviceminded and very informative. For sure we would like to come back and visit again

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, but very hard bed”
Reviews.Author: KiRae84
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay in this hotel this June/July. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Unfortunatly the bed was very hard, so we didn't slept very well. But price wise it's a good choose; close to all attractions, good staff, simple, but clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service in Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 499507John
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be recommended as offering excellent value and service situated in a very conveniant position in the Old City Istanbul close to all the attractions. The room was cleaned, sheets changed and new towels provided every day by a very friendly lady, service was excellent and always with a smile, Emin the porter and all the staff were great. If you are staying in Istanbul this must represent outstanding value with a good breakfast and very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “An awful place that you don't want to come in, but then it is even harder to leave...”
Reviews.Author: LumosMaxima
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nightmare... We arrived for a 5 days stay as its rating on booking.com was high and reviews were very favourable. The result: we ran away a day after, with a scandal. First, the address which they put on the web, for some reason, does not exist so we spent 30 min looking for it. Second, it is old. I have nothing against ancient houses with one requirement though - it should be clean. BUT this place is dirty, very-very dirty. The rooms are very small, dark, never renovated. Furniture set includes a bed or two with no carcasses, wardrobe with missing handles and a tiny TV with 3 channels. Each and every piece is falling apart there... There is no normal bathroom door, the substitute is a plastic folding curtain that does not close properly. Our friends got even a better deal: a toilet chair was located RIGHT IN THE shower cabin. Such rooms you normally get at 20 euro per night in a backpacker hostel, but not for 70 euro... We wanted to check out immediately, but the owner threatened that we would have to pay a penalty which included a one night stay (which was fine with us) PLUS some COMMISSION (?) which, as he said, he had to pay to booking.com for our reservation. After we contacted booking.com and filed a complaint, he went further threatening us that if we didn't pay FULL amount for 5 nights right away, he would call the police and would not let us go... At some point he went simply mad and started to behave like a cheap action movie character screaming things like "this is my -- hotel", "I am the boss here" and etc. That was bizarre... At the end, we paid him one night stay plus a penalty for another night in cash. Later on this day, however, he filed booking.com system a "no-show" for us so to be able to extract a "no-show" fee from the credit cards... So, we had to block them and complain again... I strongly discourage people from staying in this hotel. Though, you might be fascinated by old buildings and love it all there, but guests should not be treated in such a disgusting, disregarding manner... So, if you don't want to end up in a situation like ours, better go some place else... Our story had a happy end. Just around the corner we found a nice, cozy hotel where for 65 euro a night we got the quality and service we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but got ripped off”
Reviews.Author: snoblesnoble
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pleasant enough although the bathroom door was hanging off! The receptionist recomended the restaurant next door (to the left as you leave the hotel) but we got completely and utterly and massively overcharged and ripped off. The restaurant manager just stared agressively when we tried to appeal. Avoid it at all costs as their food is cold and/or burnt.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel Ive stayed at should be condemed..”
Reviews.Author: siaorse
Reviews.Content: we arrived early morning and checked in our bedroom was the size of a closet with a slanted bed..manager informed us he would upgrade to a suite the following day...suite had toilet in shower stall..we moved around the corner to the Qinn OLD CITYsame price but a million times better brand new hotel with wonderful staff and elevators that actually let you off on your floor unlike grand Seigneur where you still had to walk up or down to room...I promise you there is NOTHING GRAND about GrAND SEIGNEUR...dont waste your time or money..DIRTY OLD Should be condemed!

Reviews.Title: “Good comprise between price/quality”
Reviews.Author: Californian4ever
Reviews.Content: Well, if you're looking for a nice place in Istanbul to stay there several days and enjoy also the charm of the hostel, it might not be the best hostel for you. But if you're considering the cheap price of the rooms,and the fact that the hostel was quite so close from the historical center of Istanbul, you can say that it's worth it. I was looking for a hostel to stay in Istanbul just for 1 night, so I appreciated being downtown and also enjoyed the conviviality.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the worst I had ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Vyborny9
Reviews.Content: I booked single room for one night and it costs 50EUR, but it doen't deserve at all. Room No.516 is awful. The room on the top floor is very very small and ugly and bathroom is also not clean and too old. When you take a shower, around toilet also gets wet. And only small tower was there. I shoud take photos, but I didn't want to remind the awful room anymore. The room is located next to the elevator and I always hear noise. Staff looks like freindly but a big liar. I was told the whirling dervish show is 40EUR, but actually it is 40YTL. I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel attendant”
Reviews.Author: neeci_mhc
Reviews.Content: Although we were a bit dissapointed with the room, it was more like a 2-star and was quite small, we did enjoy our stay. The hotel attentant, Hamza was amazing. He was there at breakfast and was there in the evening, giving advice, recommending restaurants, shopping and night life venues. Hamza was the only person in the hotel that spoke English, without him we would have been lost. Hamza is the hotel's best asset!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people you can stay with”
Reviews.Author: jerryneyk
Reviews.Content: I admit when I first looked at the outside of the hotel, it looked a little dowdy with a little charm on a non descript street. As soon as we pulled up in the courtesy car that took us from the airport (4 day stay or more) out jumped three people to help my wife and baby, get us settled, give us a glass of wine and basically bent over backwards sincerely to make sure we were happy. I am not putting this hotel in the luxury class of any hotel I have been to and-on business-I've been to some gems. But in terms of warmth, friendliness, they are gems. A bit ditzy, you can expect the usual 'uncle Ozul' every morning trying to get you on the overpriced Bosphorus tour at breakfast, slightly confusing check out procedures, at times chaotic issues in the hotel, but all smoothed over for you by really nice slightly nutty people. We even left our 15 month old with the 20 year old guy babysit that's how much we trusted them-and we are VERY picky about babysitters. He charged about ten dollars for four hours. Lots to do in the neighborhood, about a ten minute or so walk to the main sights, and the neighborhood had a dowdy funky fun feel to it-we never felt unsafe there although for people only accustomed to 'the West' it takes a few days to feel like Turkey is OK And it is, I love Istanbul and have been there seven times and would come back to this hotel in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “historical area”
Reviews.Author: redgirlRussia
Reviews.Content: I liked to much from grand seigneur(barbaros hayrettin) nice staff asked to me always free tea coffee, and wine. like my home, thanks engin for everythink.

Reviews.Title: “"best hotel staff"”
Reviews.Author: mini25Slovenia
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is super (near tram station & some city attractions). The rooms and some parts of hotel would need some renovation, but after dissatisfaction with assigned room we were transferred to a new room (bigger and much nicer). The choice for breakfast was OK, but would be nice if they could offer some other types of cheese/sausages not just one. The best thing about accommodation in this hotel is their staff. They are absolutely amazing. I must say that they helped us with very useful advices (transport, sightseeing, restaurants, culture, etc.). My warmest thanks goes to Omer and Nemi who always took the time to help and gave answers to different questions. Really the best hotel staff I came across during my travelling abroad. Because of such people the city itself has special place in memories... Slovenian guests

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars - Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jjjodoin
Reviews.Content: We expected many things from the 4 star rating and the list of room facilities but were very disappointed. A mouldy room greeted us and it was very basic. "where are the slippers?" and the many other things that were on the website. It was a dump. After we spoke to the manager, they upgraded us to a better room but it was still disappointing compared to the write up on lastminute.com. If we knew what we realistically could expect, then this hotel would not be so bad for a cheap place close to Istanbul's action. Expect 1 to 2 stars! BTW, internet never worked passed the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Smart choice for real tourists”
Reviews.Author: IonutRomania
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent: - 5 minutes walk from the railway station; - 5 minutes walk from two tram stations (Gulhane or Sirkeci), by the way one of the best trams in Europe; - 15-20 minutes walk from five (half) of the top ten attractions in Istanbul (Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofya, The Blue Mosque, The Archeology Museum and Eminonu Harbor to start the Bosphorus Cruise). The staff is very friendly and helpful, and one of them Hamza exceeds them all. Just ask and you will hardly need another guide. The rooms are not so big but clean. The rest of the accommodations are just correct for the price that you pay. Be smart and think a little, you are in the middle of the Old Istanbul, so you will hardly find large rooms. I visited Istanbul with my wife and one of my sons so we checked other five hotels before choosing. In the area you will find better accommodations only for a double price! You will even find modern and fancy hotels but in the modern part of the City, far â€¦ far away and you will have to pay at least three times the price. So stay at Grand Seigneur if you are a tourist interested in history, art, museums, city walks, architecture, learning about the local culture, lifestyle and cuisine, shopping souvenirs etc. Find a hotel in another part of the City if you have lots of money to throw away, and your only interests are: nightlife, discos, fancy restaurants and bars, shopping Gucci and Versace. Ä°stanbul'a seviyorum.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a 4 star hotel, but it is quite OK”
Reviews.Author: HelenaRupar
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great - it is 5 minute walking distance to the all main atraction. Personal in hotel is very friendly, useful and helpful. If you need hotel just for sleeping, this hotel for this price (we paid 210 EURO for 2 persons for 6 nights) is definitely the best choice. It is a nice budget hotel with small rooms and basic facilities, like shower (toilet is in the shower), towels, telephone, tv, mini bar and hair dryer. It is not more than that. Breakfast was just a basic cold breakfast. Rooms should be better. The walls are falling down and this is not the real issue but what I could see in the pictures was totaly different. This hotel is advertised as 4 star hotel, but it shouldn't be listed as 4 star hotel, just 2 stars....

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you can avoid it”
Reviews.Author: goochieUK
Reviews.Content: We thought we would try to save some money and stay at the Grand Seigneur, but if you can afford to stay somewhere else then I would. The room was a good size, but very basic. The decor was very old and tired, and it didn't seem particularly clean. The airconditioning blew directly on the bed, and the direction of the fan couldn't be changed which made it uncomfortable. There was 1000's of TV channels, but only about 5 that werein English, and none were channels you would normally expect (no movies, BBC, CNN etc). One upside was the minibar was well stocked with cheap drinks. The breakfast was terrible (unless you like olives, tomatoes and cucumber for breakfast), and every morning we went for breakfast we found there was something missing - either plates, cutlery, glasses etc. So I would avoid this place if you can.

Reviews.Title: “friendly”
Reviews.Author: daithi11
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed to the hotel and instantly given two hot glasses of turkish apple tea.The hotel is in an excellent position at the heart of the tourist area of Istanbul.Our hotel room had a view of the Bosphorous a beautiful seating area in the room where I sat like the Sultan of Istanbul.The balcony opened out to find an unplugged treadmill and some paint rollers that seemed abandoned.However the hotel was nice and the staff did everything they could to make us feel welcome.The manager Hamed (?) was of great help assisting us with the internet ad running up and down the stairs to collect the items we printed.Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: hjkdshf
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly. Our badroom was very small (shower and toilet behind the showercurtain). One day we got no towels, but we didn't ask for it. Don't expect to much for breakfast. It's o.k. but not excellent. For this price I don't think you will get much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: zerline
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty quaint in a very accessible location. It is not as amazing as the pictures make it out to be, but the place does grow on you. I did not like the poor lighting in the room and bathroom, but the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Because it is so cheap, I think it's quite good value for money as it's placed in such a good location. Both airconditioning and heating are available. I believe some of the rooms were being refurbished during our stay. Some of the more expensive rooms were more comfortable of course. Everyone staying there at the time appeared to be quite satisfied and happy with their arrangements. Internet available in all rooms and although not high speed, certainly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 4* hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Deeniebobeenie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to be told that we had been booked into a double room, not the triple room which we had in fact booked [and paid for up front!]. The hotel staff did not apologise for the error, nor did they explain how or why it happened. We consequently spent the first night of our trip in a shabby, extremely cramped, double room. We only received our triple room the next day, after much confrontation with the hotel staff. Donâ€™t be fooled by the pictures you see online of this hotel. The rooms are in desperate need of refurbishment. Our room had mould growing in the corners, a manually operated air conditioning unit which was too high for us to reach, a bathroom that was poorly lit, had no toiletries and was barely big enough for one person to move around in. There was only one plug point in the room, which was not enough to plug in the lamp, refrigerator and TV at the same time, so you had to choose which one you wanted to use. Overall, the hotel is shabby, ill-equipped and extremely badly managed. As others before me have said, the breakfast room can only hold about 10 people, so don't be surprised if you arrive there to find that you have to wait to eat breakfast. The selection of breakfast foods is extremely poor and we often had to ask for plates, cutlery, etc as there was often not enough clean crockery available. The only advantage to this hotel is that the location is very good, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia are all within 15 minutes walk of the hotel. However, there is an abundance of better (and cheaper!) hotels in the vicinity. All in all, our trip was definitely dampened by the terrible experience we had there. This hotel is by no means a 4* hotel, itâ€™s more like a 2*.

Reviews.Title: “location great - room not so”
Reviews.Author: Traveller76England
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and the staff are friendly. But my room had the lift mechanism in a cupboard in it and it's hard to sleep when you can hear the lift whirring everytime it's used. The bedding was clean and the bathroom was pretty clean - but the toilet bowl was not clean to western standards. The bathroom was a little smelly. The sink ridiculously low and hard to use without hitting your head on the shelf. My first morning there was no water. One night I had to wait an hour for my room key as the cleaner had taken it with them when they left! I also had to wait for a key when I checked it. Their leaflet says their breakfast room holds 35 - it seats 18 around 4 table - very cramped. I am genuinely suprised to see this rated as 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: redhenry
Reviews.Content: I'd booked this on the basis of excellent reviews. I found, however, that the rooms are very cramped, there was a hole in the bathroom ceiling, the curtains do not fit properly [important when the hotel opposite is about 15 feet away], the street is very noisy and there is not enough space in the breakfast room. I overheard a German guest mutter, 'this place is catastrophic' when we were trying to find a seat for breakfast. Also, the buffet had not been replenished and various items were dried up, I presume from having been put out for several days. This place might be OK for the backpacker and party crowd, but anyone over 40 looking for a stress-free stay in Istanbul would do well to avoid it and head for the delightful 'Ada' hotel about 15 minutes' walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Peggy38
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel, the location is excellent, within walking distance of all the historical sights, the rooms are clean but a little basic . The staff make you feel so welcome, especially Hamza and Engin, they really are a credit to the Hotel. Thanks for all your help :).

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: Lou-Carey
Reviews.Content: From the onset, our stay at Grand Seigneur Hotel was outstanding! Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly by the wonderful reception team who offered us wine and tea and who then proceeded to tell us all about the attractions of the city of Istanbul. We were pleased to find the hotel to be located in a safe area which was very central to all of the main sights, as well as excellent restaurants and coffee houses. Our triple room was spacious and comfortable, with cosy beds, a nice bathroom and an impressive view of the city. The decor was very interesting & authentic. The breakfast each morning was delicious and a steady stream of tea and coffee was provided around the clock! What really 'made' our holiday was the excellent service provided by Hamza, Diyar and Mehmet who were so friendly, helpful & entertaining! The Grand Seigneur Hotel experience is one to be thoroughly recommended --- Louise, Helen & Gail.

Reviews.Title: “Sucked”
Reviews.Author: Kukla17
Reviews.Content: We booked a holiday at this hotel. Upon arrival at 2000, the hotel manager informed us that the hotel was overbooked and that we were being walked to their sister hotel, Sirkeci Park Hotel. The hotel was horrible and I would not recommend anyone stay there. Another review will be listed under that specific hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, kind staff”
Reviews.Author: IgorMinsk
Reviews.Content: Hamza is the best man in hotel!!!His service is super. Room needs reparing.

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming and friendly staff. Cosy hotel with character.”
Reviews.Author: kustah_kiz
Reviews.Content: Service was faultless, very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Rooms are decent size with plenty of storage for your clothes, room cleaned everyday and towels changed. Had TV, air con and mini fridge. Located in a smell back street where its quiet but is walking distance to sultanahmet, blue mosque and other sightseeing. local transport very close. Exchange office very close and grand bazaar. Can't think of any amenities that weren't! Plenty of cafes and restaurants. Very much liked the individuality/character of the hotel (is an old hotel) and that everything was nearby. One thing i didn't like was that in some of the rooms the toilet is in the same cubical as the shower, meaning everytime u had a shower the toilet got soaking, aswel as the floor around it. Overall i'd highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “hamza is the best!”
Reviews.Author: abidarbuka
Reviews.Content: very nice and confortable hotel in a very good location (very near to the most important things in the city). super stuff, especially hamza, really sympathic and helpful guy! a good hotel for easy people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money with a fantastic location and the best room.”
Reviews.Author: GailPerth_Australia
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's second experience here and we were upgraded as promised to a wonderful room with a fabulous view (not flash but comfortable). The staff were warm and friendly and hence we enjoyed the service received. The location is very central to everything, train stop just around the corner, a short walk to the Blue Mosque (uphill) and central shopping area. There are really no extra amenities - a small breakfast area however was sufficient and we ate other meals at restaurants close by. Loved the location and staff, really nothing bad to say at all, a great experience and highly recommended for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: spraytanqueen
Reviews.Content: the grand seigneur hotel must be the most friendly hotel i have ever stayed in, the manager serkan sezer was very friendly and made my stay most comfortable, it is situated in the old area of the city and is very well situated near shops for convenience. the hotel was very clean and room had everything you need for your holiday, sateilite tv, clean beds,bathroom very clean with hairdryer and it felt like home with the staff being very friendly and very helpful. they work very hard to please all guests. i cant wait to go back to istanbul and come stay in the grand seigneur . i will every trip. thank you to all the staff for a very enjoyable trip. see you all again soon. xx

Reviews.Title: “4ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã�§ã�¯ã�ªã�„ã�Œå®‰å®¿ã�¨åˆ�ã‚�ã�‹ã‚‰ã‚�ã�‹ã�£ã�¦è¡Œã��ã�ªã‚‰ã�¨ã�¦ã‚‚è‰¯ã�„”
Reviews.Author: HHHYYY
Reviews.Content: å¥³ä¸€äººæ—…ã� ã�£ã�Ÿã�®ã�§ä¾¿åˆ©ã�ªå ´æ‰€ã�§4æ˜Ÿãƒ›ãƒ†ãƒ«ã�¨æ€�ã�£ã�¦ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ�ãƒƒãƒˆã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã‚’ã�„ã��ã�¤ã‚‚æ¯”ã�¹ã�¦äºˆç´„ã�—ã�¾ã�—ã�Ÿã€‚ã€€å†¬ã�ªã�®ã�§ã‚ªãƒ•ã‚·ãƒ¼ã‚ºãƒ³ã� ã�£ã�Ÿã�®ã�§æ ¼å®‰ã� ã�£ã�Ÿã�®ã�§ã�™ã�Œãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ» Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: hristoenator
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the old part of the city, very close to historical places of Istanbul. It is very cosy and decorated in old fashion style. The hotel stuff is very friendly and helpful. Parking at reasonable price and wireless internet also add good impression. The rooms and the bathrooms need some repairing. The price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it if you top the location and service over room quality”
Reviews.Author: SoniaLovesHairyFish
Reviews.Content: Reading peopleâ€™s reviews here, I was a little worried about how extreme ppl rate it â€“ some rating it 5 and some rating it just 1. And I noticed most of those who loved it gave them the credit based on the location and services and those who trashed it for the reason of the room qualities. So before we started the trip, I told myself we shouldnâ€™t expect too much of the rooms. The good services started even before we set off. Even though we booked this place via another website, we got an email from the hotel directly very soon asking about the airport pick-up. Knowing we travelled by train from Greece, they gave the info about direction from the train station. Other good services included offering us free (and this is extra) breakfast on our first day (since we arrived rather early), providing info with patience about sight-seeing, good services for serving breakfast etc. I also like the fact that you can use the internet on a hotel-provided laptop for free. As for the location, itâ€™s very close to the train station, just 2 min walk â€“ worked for us perfectly. Itâ€™s also close to everything else, the Topkali Palace, Ag. Sofia, Blue Mosque, Yeni Mosque, Egyptian Bazaar, the trams station, the ferry quay, souvenir shops, food shops/restaurants, a supermarket, money-changing places, internet cafÃ© etcâ€¦ At the same time, itâ€™s in a quieter area in Sultanahmet, esp. in the evening, just occasionally I could hear the noise from the street when one night a truck was loading something next door. Now, the room itself. It wasnâ€™t as bad as I prepared to accept, but I could also understand why some previous guests said itâ€™s not up to the level of a boutique hotel. In general, we were happy with it. Itâ€™s comfortable and clean. The only only only thing I would â€œcomplainâ€� is the noise, sometimes from downstairs (the music theyâ€™re playing in the lobby), sometimes from other guests going upstairs. Maybe itâ€™s just our room â€“ 112, just opposite the stairs. Breakfast was adequate and options are decently plenty. We got a very good price from a hotel booking website and we would say itâ€™s really good value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: yovev
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed in the beginning, but our experince became more and more positive. The staff was most helpful and went out of their way to please us. Altogether we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Cozy, friendly and lovable"”
Reviews.Author: LadyKarla
Reviews.Content: I spent nearly 11 nights at this hotel and I simply have no complaints. I spent a wonderful time sorrounded by a staff who was very pleaseble, attentinve and corteous. I recommend this place if you're travelling alone or with a group of friends. You'll have a blast and will find in some of their workers a good trip advisor or talker. Don't forget to sip a little wine at the lobby before you go to bed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay!”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller2133
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually end up staying in the Grand Seigneur but the sister one on the opposite side of the road because it was full, but we took our breakfast at GS every morning and had a drink there in the evenings. The food was fantastic and the staff so very friendly and helpful and courteous. Furthermore, there is a restaurant just around the corner called 'Urfalim' which I believe is linked to the GS. The food was the best we had our entire time in Istanbul and was very reasonably priced. Please don't be put off by the exterior as it was excellent. We'd like to thank Haleel, David and all the staff at the hotels who made our time in IStanbul so fantastic! Maria Anita and Joshua Pain

Reviews.Title: “Fans of the Grand Seigneur”
Reviews.Author: BradenAngelina
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced and the staff is super friendly, generous, kind and honest. Our room was very confortable for what we have payed. When returning to the hotel in the evening, we were served fruit and were offered a drink for free. The hotel is cozy and originally traditionally furnished, we really felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manos-Lena
Reviews.Content: Definetely not a 4-star hotel, as described. A relatively good choice, but not excactly as seen in photos.The rooms are cosy, but there are problems, mainly in the bathrooms. All of the personnel is very helpful and very polite.

HotelInfo.Name: Historical Preferred Hotel Oldcity
HotelInfo.Address: Nobethane Caddesi, Tayahatun Sok. No:15 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34420, Turkey
